EN.name: Unai Fernandez
EN.title: Frontend Developer üßë‚Äçüíª
EN.resume: Web developer with over three years of experience in software development. Mainly working as a frontend developer at the start-up Lookiero, also handling some backend tasks with Java.  Collaborating with designers to implement user interfaces from Figma designs, and with the backend team to define and consume REST API contracts using JSON.
story: My story isn't so different from others, but it's mine. I've always loved science, so when I was 18, I decided to study geology at university. Somewhere along the way, I discovered programming and realized I liked that too. These days, programming is a big part of science, so it felt natural to dig into both.

Some people say I completely changed careers, but I don't really see it that way. After finishing university, I trained to become a software developer. I've now got three years of experience working at a startup in Bilbao called Lookiero. Right now, I'm still learning and always working to improve my skills as a developer.

I feel like I am more than just a web dev. I really enjoy being part of a team that loves building cool stuff. Honestly, I don't care much about what tech we use to do an application. I wish I had time to try out every programming language, but I mostly stick to JavaScript (with React) and Python. Online, people argue about their favorite languages like it's some kind of cult, so I guess JavaScript and Python are mine.

I'm always open to other people's ideas, and I try to share mine without stepping on anyone's toes. I keep it professional at work, but outside of that, I'm outgoing. So feel free to contact me. I'm open-minded and always have a smile on my face.
